alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia; Franklin; Madison; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 1:59PM CST until January 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, a mixture of freezing rain and sleet. Ice accumulation one tenth to one quarter of an inch possible with additional light sleet accumulation. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Louisiana and central, east central, northeast, southwest and west central Mississippi. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become dangerous with dangerously low wind chills expected. There may be a few power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. If going outdoors, wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for Mississippi can be obtained by visiting mdottraffic.com, dotd.la.gov in Louisiana and idrivearkansas.com in Arkansas.
